member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CheckedExpression.ProjectAsNonConstantIExpression
member.summary: Returns an object that implements IExpression and that represents this expression after language specific rules have been applied to it in order to determine its semantics. The resulting expression is a standard representation of the semantics of this expression, suitable for use by language agnostic clients and complete enough for translation of the expression into IL.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CheckedExpression.SetContainingExpression(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct an Expression before constructing the containing Expression. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CheckedExpression.CouldBeInterpretedAsNegativeSignedInteger

member.summary: Returns the name a method must have to overload this operator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Comma.InferType
member.summary: Infers the type of value that this expression will evaluate to. At runtime the actual value may be an instance of subclass of the result of this method. Calling this method does not cache the computed value and does not generate any error messages. In some cases, such as references to the parameters of lambda expressions during type overload resolution, the value returned by this method may be different from one call to the next. When type inference fails, Dummy.Type is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CompileTimeConstant.#ctor(System.Object,System.Boolean,Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: Initializes an expression that does not change its value at runtime and that can be evaluated at compile time.

The location in the source text of the expression that corresponds to this constant.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CompileTimeConstant.#ctor(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)

member.param: The actual value of the expression. Can be null.
If false, then the expression is is numerlic literal that includes an explicit indication of the numeric type to use. For example 1.1f.

True if the constant is a positive integer that could be interpreted as a negative signed integer. The location in the source text of the expression that corresponds to this constant. For example, 0x80000000, could be interpreted as a convenient way of writing int.MinValue.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CompileTimeConstant.ConvertToTargetTypeIfIntegerInRangeOf(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If the value of this compile time constant is an integer that falls in the range of the given (numeric) target type, the method returns a polymorhpic compile time constant whose Type value is the given target type. Otherwise the method returns this constant.
member.param: The (numeric) target type.
If true, a negative value may be converted to an unsigned value by reinterpreting the bits.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CompileTimeConstant.ConvertToBoxedValueOfTargetTypeIfIntegerInRangeOf(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If the value of this compile time constant is a boxed integer and if that integer value falls in the range of the given (numeric) target type, then convert the value of this constant to the target type and return it as a boxed value of that type. If the target type if not an integral type, or if the conversion is not possible, then this.Value is returned. Note that this.Value may be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CompileTimeConstant.ConvertToUnsigned(System.Object)
member.summary: If the given object is a signed integer, convert it to an unsigned integer with the same bit pattern.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeExpression,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression},Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: Allocates an expression that invokes an object constructor.
member.param: The type of object to create.
The arguments to pass to the constructor, indexer or method
The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement,Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance)
member.summary: A copy constructor that allocates an instance that is the same as the given template, except for its containing block.
member.param: A new value for containing block. This replaces template.ContainingBlock in the resulting copy of template.
The template to copy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.ICodeVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(ICreateObjectInstance) method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SourceVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(CreateObjectInstance) method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance.GetCandidateMethods(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a collection of methods that represent the constructors for the named type.
member.param: This flag is ignored, since constructors cannot have generic parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance.MakeCopyFor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement)
member.summary: Makes a copy of this expression, changing the ContainingBlock to the given block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance.ProjectAsNonConstantIExpression
member.summary: Returns an object that implements IExpression and that represents this expression after language specific rules have been applied to it in order to determine its semantics. The resulting expression is a standard representation of the semantics of this expression, suitable for use by language agnostic clients and complete enough for translation of the expression into IL.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance.SetContainingExpression(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct an Expression before constructing the containing Expression. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance.ComplainAboutCallee
member.summary: Called when the arguments are good and no type inferences have failed. This means that the callee could not be found. Complain.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance.IsVirtualCall
member.summary: True if the method to call is determined at run time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance.ObjectType
member.summary: The type of object to create.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstance.Type
member.summary: The type of value that the expression will evaluate to, as determined at compile time.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstanceForResolvedConstructor
member.summary: An expression that invokes an object constructor that has already been resolved. Only for use during projection. I.e. do not contruct this node from a parser.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstanceForResolvedConstructor.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression},Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: An expression that invokes an object constructor that has already been resolved. Only for use during projection. I.e. do not contruct this node from a parser.
member.param: The constructor to invoke.
The arguments to pass to the constructor, indexer or method. These are expected to already be converted to match the constructor's parameter types.
The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstanceForResolvedConstructor.ConvertArguments
member.summary: Returns the list of the arguments that was provided to the constructor. The caller of the constructor already performed the conversions, so this routine does nothing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstanceForResolvedConstructor.GetCandidateMethods(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an empty collection. This routine should never be called since ResolveMethod is overridden with a trivial implementation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstanceForResolvedConstructor.MakeCopyFor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement)
member.summary: Makes a copy of this expression, changing the ContainingBlock to the given block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateObjectInstanceForResolvedConstructor.ResolveMethod
member.summary: Returns the constructor that was provided when this object was construct. Does not re-resolve the method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateArray.CheckForErrorsAndReturnTrueIfAnyAreFound

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateArray.SameShape(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression,Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression,Microsoft.Cci.Ast.AstErrorMessage@)

Other element of initializer
Error object, if returning false

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateArray.SameStaticShape(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.AstErrorMessage@)
member.summary: Recursively checks that each size expression is a compile time constant matching the number of elements at the corresponding level in the initializer. Also checks that size expressions are of int32 type.

member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(ICreateArray) method.

member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(CreateArray) method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateArray.GetDimensionSizeFromInitializers(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the size of the given dimension by counting up the number of initializer expressions in the given dimension.
member.param: The dimension to size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateArray.InferType
member.summary: Infers the type of value that this expression will evaluate to. At runtime the actual value may be an instance of subclass of the result of this method. Calling this method does not cache the computed value and does not generate any error messages. In some cases, such as references to the parameters of lambda expressions during type overload resolution, the value returned by this method may be different from one call to the next. When type inference fails, Dummy.Type is returned.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.CreateDelegateInstance

The method that is to be be called when the delegate instance is invoked.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GetTypeOfTypedReference.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression,Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: Allocates an expression that results in an instance of System.Type that represents the compile time type that has been paired with a runtime value via a typed reference. This corresponds to the __reftype operator in C#.
member.param: An expression that should result in a value of type System.TypedReference.
The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

member.summary: A copy constructor that allocates an instance that is the same as the given template, except for its containing block.
member.param: A new value for containing block. This replaces template.ContainingBlock in the resulting copy of template.
The template to copy.

member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(GetTypeOfTypedReference) method.

member.summary: Makes a copy of this expression, changing the ContainingBlock to the given block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GetTypeOfTypedReference.ProjectAsNonConstantIExpression
member.summary: Returns an object that implements IExpression and that represents this expression after language specific rules have been applied to it in order to determine its semantics. The resulting expression is a standard representation of the semantics of this expression, suitable for use by language agnostic clients and complete enough for translation of the expression into IL.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GetTypeOfTypedReference.Type
member.summary: The type of value that the expression will evaluate to, as determined at compile time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GetTypeOfTypedReference.TypedReference
member.summary: An expression that should result in a value of type System.TypedReference.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GetValueOfTypedReference

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Implies

member.summary: Initializes a binary operation performed on a left and right operand, but with short circuiting (not evaluating the right operand, depending on the value of the left operand).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.LogicalBinaryOperation.ProjectAsNonConstantIExpression
member.summary: Returns an object that implements IExpression and that represents this expression after language specific rules have been applied to it in order to determine its semantics. The resulting expression is a standard representation of the semantics of this expression, suitable for use by language agnostic clients and complete enough for translation of the expression into IL.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.LogicalBinaryOperation.ProjectAsStandardLogicalOperator
member.summary: Returns an expression that is the projection of a standard short circuit operator. In the case of a logical and, this is the projection of (bool)x ? (bool)y : false;

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.LogicalBinaryOperation.ProjectAsUserDefinedOverloadAsLogicalOperator(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodCall)
member.summary: Returns an expression that is the projection of a user defined short circuit operator. In the case of a logical or, this is the projection of let tx = (T)x in T.op_True(tx) ? tx : T.op_BitwiseOr(tx, (T)y).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.LogicalBinaryOperation.StandardOperators
member.summary: A list of dummy methods that correspond to operations that are built into IL. The dummy methods are used, via overload resolution, to determine how the operands are to be converted before the operation is carried out.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Indexer.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.ICodeVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IArrayIndexer) if this.IndexedObject is an array, otherwise calls this.ProjectAsIExpression().Dispatch(visitor).

member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(Indexer) method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Indexer.FactoredExpression
member.summary: Either returns this expression, or returns a BlockExpression that assigns each subexpression to a temporary local variable and then evaluates an expression that is the same as this expression, but which refers to the temporaries rather than the factored out subexpressions. This transformation is useful when expressing the semantics of operation assignments and increment/decrement operations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Indexer.GetCandidateMethods(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a collection of methods that match the name of the method/indexer to call, or that represent the collection of constructors for the named type.
member.param: If this flag is true, generic methods should be included in the collection if their method parameter types could not be inferred from the argument types.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Indexer.GetPointerAdditionMethods(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Returns a collection of methods that represents the overloads for ptr + index.

member.summary: Returns an object that implements IExpression and that represents this expression after language specific rules have been applied to it in order to determine its semantics. The resulting expression is a standard representation of the semantics of this expression, suitable for use by language agnostic clients and complete enough for translation of the expression into IL.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Indexer.ProjectAsDereferencedPointerAddition
member.summary: Returns an expression corresponding to *(ptr + index) where ptr is this.IndexedObject and index is the first element of this.ConvertedArguments.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Indexer.ResolveAsValueContainer
member.summary: Results in null or an array indexer or an indexer (property) definition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Indexer.SetContainingExpression(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct an Expression before constructing the containing Expression. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Indexer.IndexedObject
member.summary: An expression that results in value whose type is expected to be an array, or to define a default indexed property that matches the indices.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Indexer.IsVirtualCall
member.summary: True if the method to call is determined at run time, based on the runtime type of IndexedObject.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.IsFalse
member.summary: An expression that returns true if the value of the its operand is false or can be converted to false. In VB the IsFalse operator corresponds to this kind of expression. When overloaded, this expression corresponds to a call to op_False.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.CheckForErrorsAndReturnTrueIfAnyAreFound
member.summary: Performs any error checks still needed and returns true if any errors were found in the statement or a constituent part of the statement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.CreateOverloadMethodCall(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition)
member.summary: Returns a method call object that calls the given overloadMethod with this.LeftOperand and this.RightOperands as arguments. The operands are converted to the corresponding parameter types using implicit conversions. If overloadMethod is the Dummy.Method a DummyMethodCall is returned.
member.param: A user defined operator overload method or a "builtin" operator overload method, or a dummy method. The latter can be supplied when the expression is in error because one or both of the arguments cannot be converted the correct parameter type for a valid overload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.GetOperatorMethods(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Returns an enumeration of methods that overload this operator. If no user defined methods exists, it returns a list of dummy methods that correspond to operators built into IL.
member.param: The type of the operand.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.GetOperatorName
member.summary: Returns the name a method must have to overload this operator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.GetUnaryBadOperandErrorMessage
member.summary: Returns an error message stating that the operand of this operation is not of the right type for the operator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.GetUserDefinedOperators(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Returns an enumeration of user defined methods that overload this operator, defined by the given type or one of its base classes.
member.param: The type whose user defined operator methods should be searched.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.GetNonDerivedUserDefinedOperators(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Returns an enumeration of user defined methods that overload this operator, defined directly by the given type.
member.param: The type whose user defined operator methods should be searched.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.HasSideEffect(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if the expression has a side effect and reports an error unless told otherwise.
member.param: If true, report an error if the expression has a side effect.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.InferType
member.summary: Infers the type of value that this expression will evaluate to. At runtime the actual value may be an instance of subclass of the result of this method. Calling this method does not cache the computed value and does not generate any error messages. In some cases, such as references to the parameters of lambda expressions during type overload resolution, the value returned by this method may be different from one call to the next. When type inference fails, Dummy.Type is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.LookForOverloadMethod
member.summary: Returns the user defined operator overload method, or a dummy method corresponding to an IL operation, that best matches the operand type of this operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.OverloadCall
member.summary: Returns the user defined or standard operator method that matches this operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.ProjectAsNonConstantIExpression
member.summary: Returns an object that implements IExpression and that represents this expression after language specific rules have been applied to it in order to determine its semantics. The resulting expression is a standard representation of the semantics of this expression, suitable for use by language agnostic clients and complete enough for translation of the expression into IL.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.SetContainingExpression(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct an Expression before constructing the containing Expression. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.CouldBeInterpretedAsNegativeSignedInteger
member.summary: True if the constant is a positive integer that could be interpreted as a negative signed integer. For example, 0x80000000, could be interpreted as a convenient way of writing int.MinValue.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.OperationSymbolForErrorMessage
member.summary: Returns the string used to identify the operator in error messages

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.Operand
member.summary: The value on which the operation is performed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.OverloadMethodCall
member.summary: An expression that calls the user defined operator overload method that best matches the operand type of this operation. If no such method can be found, the value of this property is null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.StandardOperators
member.summary: A list of dummy methods that correspond to operations that are built into IL. The dummy methods are used, via overload resolution, to determine how the operands are to be converted before the operation is carried out.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.Type
member.summary: The type of value that the expression will evaluate to, as determined at compile time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnaryOperation.ValueIsPolymorphicCompileTimeConstant
member.summary: Returns true if the expression represents a compile time constant without an explicitly specified type. For example, 1 rather than 1L. Constant expressions such as 2*16 are polymorhpic if both operands are polymorhic.

member.summary: Creates a left shift expression with the given left operand and this.RightOperand. The method does not use this.LeftOperand.Expression, since it may be necessary to factor out any subexpressions so that they are evaluated only once. member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Like.InferType
member.summary: Infers the type of value that this expression will evaluate to. At runtime the actual value may be an instance of subclass of the result of this method. Calling this method does not cache the computed value and does not generate any error messages. In some cases, such as references to the parameters of lambda expressions during type overload resolution, the value returned by this method may be different from one call to the next. When type inference fails, Dummy.Type is returned.

The right operand.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MakeTypedReference
member.summary: An expression that creates a typed reference (a pair consisting of a reference to a runtime value and a compile time type). This is similar to what happens when a value type is boxed, except that the boxed value can be an object and the runtime type of the boxed value can be a subtype of the compile time type that is associated with the boxed valued.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MakeTypedReference.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression,Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: Allocates an expression that creates a typed reference (a pair consisting of a reference to a runtime value and a compile time type). This is similar to what happens when a value type is boxed, except that the boxed value can be an object and the runtime type of the boxed value can be a subtype of the compile time type that is associated with the boxed valued.
member.param: The value to box in a typed reference.
The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ModulusAssignment.CreateBinaryExpression(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression)
member.summary: Creates a modulus expression with the given left operand and this.RightOperand. The method does not use this.LeftOperand.Expression, since it may be necessary to factor out any subexpressions so that they are evaluated only once. The given left operand expression is expected to be the expression that remains after factoring.
member.param: An expression to combine with this.RightOperand into a binary expression.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NonNullTypeExpression.Resolve
member.summary: The type denoted by the expression. If expression cannot be resolved, a dummy type is returned. If the expression is ambiguous the first matching type is returned. If the expression does not resolve to exactly one type, an error is added to the error collection of the compilation context.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NonNullTypeExpression.SetContainingExpression(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct an Expression before constructing the containing Expression. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.summary: Gets the type of the element.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NullCoalescing

member.summary: Allocates an expression that evaluates the first operand and results in its value if it is not null. Otherwise the second operand is evaluated and its value becomes the value of the expression. This corresponds to the ?? operator in C#.

The right operand.
The source location of the operation.

member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(NullCoalescing) method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NullCoalescing.InferType
member.summary: Infers the type of value that this expression will evaluate to. At runtime the actual value may be an instance of subclass of the result of this method. Calling this method does not cache the computed value and does not generate any error messages. In some cases, such as references to the parameters of lambda expressions during type overload resolution, the value returned by this method may be different from one call to the next. When type inference fails, Dummy.Type is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NullCoalescing.MakeCopyFor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement)
member.summary: Makes a copy of this expression, changing the ContainingBlock to the given block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NullCoalescing.ProjectAsNonConstantIExpression
member.summary: Returns let temp = a in temp == null ? b : (T)temp where T is the type of a (after removing ? if there) or type of b.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement,Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName)
member.summary: A copy constructor that allocates an instance that is the same as the given template, except for its containing block.
member.param: A new value for containing block. This replaces template.ContainingBlock in the resulting copy of template.
The template to copy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.CheckForErrorsAndReturnTrueIfAnyAreFound
member.summary: Performs any error checks still needed and returns true if any errors were found in the statement or a constituent part of the statement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.FactoredExpression
member.summary: Either returns this expression, or returns a BlockExpression that assigns each subexpression to a temporary local variable and then evaluates an expression that is the same as this expression, but which refers to the temporaries rather than the factored out subexpressions. This transformation is useful when expressing the semantics of operation assignments and increment/decrement operations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SourceVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(QualifiedName) method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.GetValue
member.summary: Computes the compile time value of the expression. Can be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.HasSideEffect(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if the expression has a side effect and reports an error unless told otherwise.
member.param: If true, report an error if the expression has a side effect.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.InferType
member.summary: Infers the type of value that this expression will evaluate to. At runtime the actual value may be an instance of subclass of the result of this method. Calling this method does not cache the computed value and does not generate any error messages. In some cases, such as references to the parameters of lambda expressions during type overload resolution, the value returned by this method may be different from one call to the next. When type inference fails, Dummy.Type is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.MakeCopyFor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement)
member.summary: Makes a copy of this expression, changing the ContainingBlock to the given block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.ProjectAsNonConstantIExpression
member.summary: Returns an object that implements IExpression and that represents this expression after language specific rules have been applied to it in order to determine its semantics. The resulting expression is a standard representation of the semantics of this expression, suitable for use by language agnostic clients and complete enough for translation of the expression into IL.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.Resolve(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns either null or the type member that binds to this name using the compile time type of the Qualifier as resolution context. Method groups are represented by the first matching method definition in the most derived type that defines or overrides methods in the group. Likewise for property groups and type groups.
member.param: Set this to true when the qualified name has failed to resolve and an appropriate error has to be generated. In particular, if the qualified name can resolve to an inaccessible member, the error will say as much.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.ResolveAsNamespaceOrTypeGroup(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns either null or the namespace or type group that binds to this name after resolving the Qualifier as a namespace or type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.ResolveAsValueContainer(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the event, field or property that binds to this qualified name using the applicable scope chain and compilation context. Returns null if qualified name does not bind to one of the above cases.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.ResolveQualifierAsNamespace(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resolves the qualifier as a namespace, provided that it is a simple name. Returns null if this is not possible.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.ResolveQualifierAsNamespaceOrType(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resolves the qualifier as a namespace or as a type. Returns null if this is not possible.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.ResolveTypeMember(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds a type member with this.SimpleName as its name. Runs up the base type chain if necessary. Returns strictly the first match.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.SetContainingExpression(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of the object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct a QualifiedName before constructing the containing Block. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itslef should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.Qualifier
member.summary: An expression that binds to an object or a type or a namespace, or something else that can serve to constrain what the name binds to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.SimpleName
member.summary: The name of an entity that is associated with the qualifier object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.QualifiedName.Type

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Range.MakeCopyFor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement)
member.summary: Makes a copy of this expression, changing the ContainingBlock to the given block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Range.ProjectAsNonConstantIExpression
member.summary: Returns an object that implements IExpression and that represents this expression after language specific rules have been applied to it in order to determine its semantics. The resulting expression is a standard representation of the semantics of this expression, suitable for use by language agnostic clients and complete enough for translation of the expression into IL.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Range.SetContainingExpression(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct an Expression before constructing the containing Expression. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Range.EndValue
member.summary: An expression resulting in the number ending the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Range.StartValue
member.summary: An expression resulting in the number starting the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Range.Type
member.summary: The type of value that the expression will evaluate to, as determined at compile time.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RefArgument
member.summary: An expression that must match a ref parameter of a method. The value of the target Expression before the call is passed to the method and the method may assigns a new value to the target Expression.

member.param: The target that is assigned to as a result of the method call, but whose value is also passed to the method at the start of the call.
The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RightShift

The right operand.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RightShift.CouldBeInterpretedAsNegativeSignedInteger
member.summary: True if the constant is a positive integer that could be interpreted as a negative signed integer. For example, 0x80000000, could be interpreted as a convenient way of writing int.MinValue.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RightShift.OperationSymbolForErrorMessage
member.summary: Returns the string used to identify the operator in error messages

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RightShift.StandardOperators
member.summary: A list of dummy methods that correspond to operations that are built into IL. The dummy methods are used, via overload resolution, to determine how the operands are to be converted before the operation is carried out.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RightShift.ValueIsPolymorphicCompileTimeConstant
member.summary: Returns true if the expression represents a compile time constant without an explicitly specified type. For example, 1 rather than 1L. Constant expressions such as 2*16 are polymorhpic if both operands are polymorhic.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RightShiftAssignment
member.summary: An expression that results in the value of the left operand, shifted right by the number of bits specified by the value of the right operand, duplicating the sign bit. The result of the expression is assigned to the left operand, which must be a target expression. When the operator is overloaded, this expression corresponds to a call to op_RightShift.

member.summary: Allocates an expression that results in the value of the left operand, shifted right by the number of bits specified by the value of the right operand, duplicating the sign bit. The result of the expression is assigned to the left operand, which must be a target expression. When the operator is overloaded, this expression corresponds to a call to op_RightShift.
member.param: The left operand and target of the assignment.
The right operand.
The source location of the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RightShiftAssignment.CreateBinaryExpression(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression)
member.summary: Creates a right shift expression with the given left operand and this.RightOperand. The method does not use this.LeftOperand.Expression, since it may be necessary to factor out any subexpressions so that they are evaluated only once. The given left operand expression is expected to be the expression that remains after factoring.
member.param: An expression to combine with this.RightOperand into a binary expression.

member.summary: Returns the name a method must have to overload this operator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ReferenceEquality.InferType
member.summary: Infers the type of value that this expression will evaluate to. At runtime the actual value may be an instance of subclass of the result of this method. Calling this method does not cache the computed value and does not generate any error messages. In some cases, such as references to the parameters of lambda expressions during type overload resolution, the value returned by this method may be different from one call to the next. When type inference fails, Dummy.Type is returned.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ResolvedMethodCall
member.summary: An expression that respresents a call to a method that has already been resolved by the time this expression is constructed. Only for use during projection. I.e. do not contruct this kind of expression from a parser.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ResolvedMethodCall.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression},Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocation)
member.summary: Allocates an expression that respresents a call to a method that has already been resolved by the time this expression is constructed. Only for use during projection. I.e. do not construct this kind of expression from a parser.
member.param: The resolved method to call. This method must be static.
The arguments to pass to the resolved method, after they have been converted to match the parameters of the resolved method. Must be fully initialized.
The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

member.summary: Checks if the expression has a side effect and reports an error unless told otherwise.

The resulting expression is a standard representation of the semantics of this expression, suitable for use by language agnostic clients and complete enough for translation of the expression into IL.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SimpleName.Resolve
member.summary: Returns either null or the local variable, parameter, type parameter, type member, namespace member or type that binds to this name using the applicable scope chain and compilation context. Method groups are represented by the first matching method definition in the most derived type that defines or overrides methods in the group. Likewise for property groups and type groups.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SimpleName.ResolveAsNamespaceOrType(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns either null or the namespace or type that binds to this name using the applicable scope chain and compilation context. When the name binds to both a type and and a namespace, only the type is returned. When the name binds to more than one type, a type group is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SimpleName.ResolveAsNamespace
member.summary: Returns either null or the namespace or that binds to this name using the applicable scope chain and compilation context.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SimpleName.ResolveAsTargetStatement
member.summary: Returns the statement labeled with this name and located in the same block as this name, or in a containing block. Returns Dummy.LabeledStatement if no such statement can be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SimpleName.ResolveAsValueContainer
member.summary: Returns either null or the local variable, parameter, field or property that binds to this name using the applicable scope chain and compilation context.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SimpleName.ResolveUsing(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns either null or the local variable, parameter, type parameter, type member, namespace member or type that binds to this name using the scope chain of the given block.
member.param: The block whose scope chain is used to resolve this name.
True if only namespaces and types should be considered when resolving this name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SimpleName.ResolveUsing(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ISignatureDeclaration,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns either null or the local variable, parameter, type parameter, type member, namespace member or type that binds to this name using the scope chain of the given method.
member.param: The signature bearing object whose scope chain is used to resolve this name.
True if only namespaces and types should be considered when resolving this name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SimpleName.ResolveUsing(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclaration,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns either null or the local variable, parameter, type parameter, type member, namespace member or type that binds to this name using the scope chain of the given type declaration. Uses a cache.
member.param: The type whose scope chain is used to resolve this name.
True if only namespaces and types should be considered when resolving this name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SimpleName.ResolveUsing(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns either null or the type member group or namespace member that binds to this name.
member.param: The type whose members and inherited members are used to resolve this name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnsignedRightShift.GetOperatorName
member.summary: Returns the name a method must have to overload this operator.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnsignedRightShift.OperationSymbolForErrorMessage
member.summary: Returns the string used to identify the operator in error messages

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnsignedRightShift.StandardOperators
member.summary: A list of dummy methods that correspond to operations that are built into IL. The dummy methods are used, via overload resolution, to determine how the operands are to be converted before the operation is carried out.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnsignedRightShiftAssignment
member.summary: An expression that results in the value of the left operand, shifted right by the number of bits specified by the value of the right operand, filling with zeros. The result of the expression is assigned to the left operand, which must be a target expression. This is for >>>=.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnsignedRightShiftAssignment.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement,Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnsignedRightShiftAssignment)
member.summary: A copy constructor that allocates an instance that is the same as the given template, except for its containing block.
member.param: A new value for containing block. This replaces template.ContainingBlock in the resulting copy of template.
The template to copy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnsignedRightShiftAssignment.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SourceVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(xxxxx) method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnsignedRightShiftAssignment.MakeCopyFor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement)
member.summary: Makes a copy of this expression, changing the ContainingBlock to the given block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnsignedRightShiftAssignment.CreateBinaryExpression(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression)
member.summary: Creates an unsigned right shift expression with the given left operand and this.RightOperand. The method does not use this.LeftOperand.Expression, since it may be necessary to factor out any subexpressions so that they are evaluated only once. The given left operand expression is expected to be the expression that remains after factoring.
member.param: An expression to combine with this.RightOperand into a binary expression.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.VectorLength.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.ICodeVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(IVectorLength) method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.VectorLength.MakeCopyFor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement)
member.summary: Makes a copy of this expression, changing the ContainingBlock to the given block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.VectorLength.ProjectAsNonConstantIExpression
member.summary: Returns an object that implements IExpression and that represents this expression after language specific rules have been applied to it in order to determine its semantics. The resulting expression is a standard representation of the semantics of this expression, suitable for use by language agnostic clients and complete enough for translation of the expression into IL.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.VectorLength.Type
member.summary: The type of value that the expression will evaluate to, as determined at compile time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.VectorLength.Vector
member.summary: An expression that results in a value of a vector (zero-based one-dimensional array) type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ITypeDeclarationMember
member.summary: A member of a type declaration, such as a field or a method. This interface models the source representation of a type member.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ITypeDeclarationMember.GetDefaultVisibility
member.summary: Returns the visibility that applies by default to this member if no visibility was supplied in the source code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ITypeDeclarationMember.MakeShallowCopyFor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclaration)
member.summary: Makes a shallow copy of this member that can be added to the member list of the given target type declaration. The shallow copy may share child objects with this instance, but should never expose such child objects except through wrappers (or shallow copies made on demand). If this instance is already a member of the target type declaration it returns itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ITypeDeclarationMember.ContainingTypeDeclaration
member.summary: The type declaration that contains this member.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ITypeDeclarationMember.IsUnsafe

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ITypeDeclarationMember.Name
member.summary: The name of the member.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ITypeDeclarationMember.TypeDefinitionMember
member.summary: The symbol table object that represents the metadata for this member. May be null if this member does not generate metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ITypeDeclarationMember.Visibility
member.summary: Indicates if the member is public or confined to its containing type, derived types and/or declaring assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.IAggregatableTypeDeclarationMember.AggregatedMember
member.summary: The single definition that is associated with this declaration and possibly other declarations too.

Indicates that this member is intended to hide the name of an inherited member.
True if the member exposes an unsafe type, such as a pointer.
Indicates if the member is public or confined to its containing type, derived types and/or declaring assembly.
The name of the member.
The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

member.param: Custom attributes that are explicitly specified in source. Some of these may not end up in persisted metadata. For example in C# a custom attribute is used to specify IFieldDefinition.IsNotSerialized. This custom attribute is deleted by the compiler.
A set of flags that specify the value of boolean properties of the member, such as IsNew.
Indicates if the member is public or confined to its containing type, derived types and/or declaring assembly.
The name of the member.
The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclaration,Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember)
member.summary: A copy constructor that allocates an instance that is the same as the given template, except for its containing type.
member.param: The containing type of the copied member. This should be different from the containing type of the template member.
The type member to copy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.CheckForErrorsAndReturnTrueIfAnyAreFound
member.summary: Performs any error checks still needed and returns true if any errors were found in the member or a constituent part of the member. Do not call this method directly, but evaluate the HasErrors property. The latter will cache the return value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.containingTypeDeclaration
member.summary: The type declaration that contains this member.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.GetAttributes
member.summary: Returns a list of custom attributes that describes this type declaration member. Typically, these will be derived from this.SourceAttributes. However, some source attributes might instead be persisted as metadata bits and other custom attributes may be synthesized from information not provided in the form of source custom attributes. The list is not trimmed to size, since an override of this method may call the base method and then add more attributes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.GetDefaultVisibility
member.summary: Returns the visibility that applies by default to this member if no visibility was supplied in the source code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.GetSourceAttributes
member.summary: If no source attributes were supplied to the constructor, this method will get called to supply them when the SourceAttributes property is evaluated. If this method returns null, it will be called every time the property is evaluated. If this is too expensive, be sure to return an empty list rather than null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.MakeShallowCopyFor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclaration)
member.summary: Makes a shallow copy of this member that can be added to the member list of the given target type declaration. The shallow copy may share child objects with this instance, but should never expose such child objects except through wrappers (or shallow copies made on demand). If this instance is already a member of the target type declaration it returns itself.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.SetContainingTypeDeclaration(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclaration,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct a type member before constructing the containing type declaration. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.Compilation
member.summary: The compilation that this declaration forms a part of.

member.summary: The compilation part that this declaration forms a part of.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.ContainingTypeDeclaration
member.summary: The type declaration that contains this member.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.HasErrors
member.summary: Checks the member for errors and returns true if any were found.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.Helper
member.summary: An instance of a language specific class containing methods that are of general utility.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.IsNew
member.summary: Indicates that this member is intended to hide the name of an inherited member.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.Name
member.summary: The name of the member.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.NameTable
member.summary: A table used to intern strings used as names. This table is obtained from the host environment. It is mutuable, in as much as it is possible to add new names to the table.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.PlatformType
member.summary: A collection of well known types that must be part of every target platform and that are fundamental to modeling compiled code. The types are obtained by querying the unit set of the compilation and thus can include types that are defined by the compilation itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.SourceAttributes
member.summary: Custom attributes that are explicitly specified in source. Some of these may not end up in persisted metadata. For example in C# a custom attribute is used to specify IFieldDefinition.IsNotSerialized. This custom attribute is deleted by the compiler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.TypeDefinitionMember
member.summary: The symbol table object that represents the metadata for this member.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclarationMember.Visibility
member.summary: Indicates if the member is public or confined to its containing type, derived types and/or declaring assembly.
Allocates a member that represents a variable associated with an object or class.
member.param: Custom attributes that are explicitly specified in source. May be null. Some of these may not end up in persisted metadata. For example in C# a custom attribute is used to specify IFieldDefinition.IsNotSerialized. Such a custom attribute is deleted by the compiler.
A set of flags that specify the value of boolean properties of the field, such as IsStatic.
Indicates if the member is public or confined to its containing type, derived types and/or declaring assembly.
An expression that denote the type of value that is stored in this field.
The name of the member.
An expression that evaluates to the initial value of this field. May be null.
The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDeclaration.CompileTimeValue
member.summary: The compile time value of the field. This value should be used directly in IL, rather than a reference to the field. If the field does not have a valid compile time value, Dummy.Constant is returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDeclaration.IsBitField

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.EventDeclaration
member.summary: An event is a member that enables an object or class to provide notifications. Clients can attach executable code for events by supplying event handlers.

Allocates an event member that enables an object or class to provide notifications. Clients can attach executable code for events by supplying event handlers. This overload provides for events that have explcitly specified methods for adding and removing handlers.
member.param: Custom attributes that are explicitly specified in source. May be null. Some of these may not end up in persisted metadata.
A set of flags that specify the value of boolean properties of the member, such as IsNew.
Indicates if the event is public or confined to its containing type, derived types and/or declaring assembly.
An expression that denote the (delegate) type of the handlers that will handle the event.
A list of interfaces whose corresponding abstract events are implemented by this event.
The name of the member.
Custom attributes specified directly on the adder method.
The body of the adder method. May be null for field like events.
Custom attributes specified directly on the remover method.
The body of the remover method. May be null for field like events.
The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

member.summary: Allocates an event member that enables an object or class to provide notifications. Clients can attach executable code for events by supplying event handlers. This overload provides for field like events.

A set of flags that specify the value of boolean properties of the member, such as IsNew.
Indicates if the event is public or confined to its containing type, derived types and/or declaring assembly.
An expression that denote the (delegate) type of the handlers that will handle the event.
The name of the member.
An expression that evaluates to the initial handler for this event.
The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement,Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration)
member.summary: A copy constructor that allocates an instance that is the same as the given template, except for its containing block.
member.param: A new value for containing block. This replaces template.ContainingBlock in the resulting copy of template.
The template to copy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.GetAttributes
member.summary: Returns a list of custom attributes that describes this type declaration member. Typically, these will be derived from this.SourceAttributes. However, some source attributes might instead be persisted as metadata bits and other custom attributes may be synthesized from information not provided in the form of source custom attributes. The list is not trimmed to size, since an override of this method may call the base method and then add more attributes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.AddConstraint(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeExpression)
member.summary: Add a constraint to this generic parameter declaration. This is done after construction of this declaration because it may contain a reference to this declaration. It should not be called after the second phase of construction has been completed.
member.param: A type expression that resolves to a type that constrains this parameter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.containingBlock
member.summary: The block that contains this declaration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.SetContainingExpression(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct a generic parameter before constructing the declaring type or method. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.Constraints
member.summary: A list of classes or interfaces. All type arguments matching this parameter must be derived from all of the classes and implement all of the interfaces.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.Compilation
member.summary: The compilation that contains this statement.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.CompilationPart
member.summary: The compilation part that this declaration forms a part of.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.ContainingBlock
member.summary: The block that contains this declaration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.Index
member.summary: The position in the parameter list where this instance can be found.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.MustBeReferenceType
member.summary: True if all type arguments matching this parameter are constrained to be reference types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.MustBeValueType
member.summary: True if all type arguments matching this parameter are constrained to be value types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.MustHaveDefaultConstructor
member.summary: True if all type arguments matching this parameter are constrained to be value types or concrete classes with visible default constructors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.Name
member.summary: The name of the entity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.SourceAttributes
member.summary: Custom attributes that are explicitly specified in source. Some of these may not end up in persisted metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameterDeclaration.Variance

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericMethodParameterDeclaration.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SourceVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(GenericMethodParameterDeclaration) method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericMethodParameterDeclaration.MakeShallowCopyFor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration)
member.summary: Makes a shallow copy of this generic parameter that can be added to the generic parameter list of the given method declaration. The shallow copy may share child objects with this instance, but should never expose such child objects except through wrappers (or shallow copies made on demand). If this instance is already a parameter of the given method declaration it returns itself.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericMethodParameterDeclaration.SetDeclaringMethod(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct a generic method parameter before constructing the declaring method declaration. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.summary: The name of the member. For example the alias of an alias declaration, the name of nested namespace and so on. Can be the empty name, for example if the construct is a namespace import.
Allocates a member that represents a variable associated with an object or class.
member.param: Custom attributes that are explicitly specified in source. May be null. Some of these may not end up in persisted metadata. For example in C# a custom attribute is used to specify IFieldDefinition.IsNotSerialized. Such a custom attribute is deleted by the compiler.
A set of flags that specify the value of boolean properties of the field, such as IsStatic.
Indicates if the member is public or confined to its containing type, derived types and/or declaring assembly.
An expression that denote the type of value that is stored in this field.
The name of the member.
An expression that evaluates to the initial value of this field. May be null.
The source location corresponding to the newly allocated expression.

member.summary: Allocates or the method definition that corresponds to this declaration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.SetContainingTypeDeclaration(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclaration,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct a type member before constructing the containing type declaration. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.AcceptsExtraArguments
member.summary: True if the method is a "vararg" method. That is, if it has a calling convention that allows extra arguments to be passed on the stack. In C++ such methods specify ... at the end of their parameter lists. In C#, the __arglist keyword is used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.Body
member.summary: The body of this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.CallingConvention
member.summary: Calling convention of the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.DummyBlock
member.summary: A block statement that serves as the declaring block of any expressions that form part of the the method declaration but that do not appear inside a method body.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.GenericParameters
member.summary: If the method is generic then this list contains the type parameters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.GenericParameterCount
member.summary: The number of generic parameters. Zero if the method is not generic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.HandledEvents
member.summary: A list of events that are declaratively handled by this method. Whenever an object is assigned to an event source in the list, the method is unhooked from the event of the previous value and hooked up to the event of the new value. In VB this corresponds to a the Handles clause of a method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.HasDeclarativeSecurity
member.summary: True if this method has a non empty collection of SecurityAttributes or the System.Security.SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurityAttribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.HasExplicitThisParameter
member.summary: True if this is an instance method that explicitly declares the type and name of its first parameter (the instance).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.ImplementedInterfaces
member.summary: A list of interfaces whose corresponding abstract methods are implemented by this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsAbstract
member.summary: True if the method does not provide an implementation (there is no body and evaluating the Body property is an error).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsAccessCheckedOnOverride
member.summary: True if the method can only be overridden when it is also accessible.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsCil
member.summary: True if the method is implemented in the CLI Common Intermediate Language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsExtensionMethod
member.summary: True if this method is a static method that can be called as an instance method on another class because it has an explicit this parameter. In other words, the class defining this static method is effectively extending another class, but doing so without subclassing it and without requiring client code to instantiate the subclass.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsExternal
member.summary: True if the method has an external implementation (i.e. not supplied by this declaration).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsForwardReference
member.summary: True if the method implementation is defined by another method definition (to be supplied at a later time). Only for use in

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsGeneric
member.summary: True if the method has generic parameters;

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsHiddenBySignature
member.summary: True if this method is hidden if a derived type declares a method with the same name and signature. If false, any method with the same name hides this method. This flag is ignored by the runtime and is only used by compilers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsNativeCode
member.summary: True if the method is implemented in native (platform-specific) code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsNeverInlined
member.summary: True if the the runtime is not allowed to inline this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsNeverOptimized
member.summary: True if the the runtime is not allowed to inline this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsPlatformInvoke
member.summary: True if the method is implemented via the invocation of an underlying platform method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsOverride
member.summary: True if this method overrides a base class method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsRuntimeImplemented
member.summary: True if the implementation of this method is supplied by the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsRuntimeInternal
member.summary: True if the method is an internal part of the runtime and must be called in a special way.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: True if the method gets special treatment from the runtime. For example, it might be a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsSealed
member.summary: True if this method may not be overridden by a derived class method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsSpecialName
member.summary: True if the method is special in some way for tools. For example, it might be a property getter or setter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsStatic
member.summary: True if the method does not require an instance of its declaring type as its first argument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsSynchronized
member.summary: True if only one thread at a time may execute this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsUnmanaged
member.summary: True if the implementation of this method is not managed by the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.IsVirtual
member.summary: True if the method may be overridden (or if it is an override).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.MethodDefinition
member.summary: The symbol table object that represents the metadata for this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.Parameters

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.PlatformInvokeData

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.PreserveSignature
member.summary: True if the method signature must not be mangled during the interoperation with COM code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.QualifiedName
member.summary: The name of this method, qualified with the name of an interface, if this method is the private implementation of an interface method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDeclaration.RequiresSecurityObject

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.EventDefinition
member.summary: An event is a member that enables an object or class to provide notifications. Clients can attach executable code for events by supplying event handlers. This interface models the source representation of an event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDefinitionMember.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IDoubleDispatcher. The dispatch method does not invoke Dispatch on any child objects. If child traversal is desired, the implementations of the Visit methods should do the subsequent dispatching.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDefinitionMember.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IDoubleDispatcher. The dispatch method does not invoke Dispatch on any child objects. If child traversal is desired, the implementations of the Visit methods should do the subsequent dispatching.

member.summary: The type definition that contains this member.
