member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(IFieldReference) method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.BitLength
member.summary: The number of bits that form part of the value of the field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.CompileTimeValue
member.summary: The compile time value of the field. This value should be used directly in IL, rather than a reference to the field. If the field does not have a valid compile time value, Dummy.Constant is returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.CustomModifiers
member.summary: The list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the field. Evaluate this property only if IsModified is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.Declaration
member.summary: The declaration that corresponds to this definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.InternedKey
member.summary: Returns a key that is computed from the information in this reference and that distinguishes this.ResolvedField from all other fields obtained from the same metadata host.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.IsBitField
member.summary: The field is aligned on a bit boundary and uses only the BitLength number of least significant bits of the representation of a Type value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.IsCompileTimeConstant
member.summary: This field is a compile-time constant. The field has no runtime location and cannot be directly addressed from IL.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.IsMapped
member.summary: This field is mapped to an explicitly initialized (static) memory location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.IsMarshalledExplicitly
member.summary: This field has associated field marshalling information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.IsModified
member.summary: This field has custom modifiers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.IsNotSerialized
member.summary: The field does not have to be serialized when its containing instance is serialized.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.IsReadOnly
member.summary: This field can only be read. Initialization takes place in a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.IsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: True if the field gets special treatment from the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.IsSpecialName
member.summary: This field is special in some way, as specified by the name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.IsStatic
member.summary: This field is static (shared by all instances of its declaring type).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.Offset
member.summary: Offset of the field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.SequenceNumber
member.summary: The position of the field starting from 0 within the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.MarshallingInformation
member.summary: Specifies how this field is marshalled when it is accessed from unmanaged code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.Type
member.summary: The type of value that is stored in this field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.FieldMapping
member.summary: Information of the location where this field is mapped to

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldDefinition.ResolvedField
member.summary: The Field being referred to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.AcceptsExtraArguments
member.summary: True if the call sites that references the method with this object supply extra arguments.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.Body
member.summary: A container for a list of IL instructions providing the implementation (if any) of this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.CallingConvention
member.summary: Calling convention of the signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.GenericParameters
member.summary: If the method is generic then this list contains the type parameters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.HasDeclarativeSecurity
member.summary: True if this method has a non empty collection of SecurityAttributes or the System.Security.SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurityAttribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.HasExplicitThisParameter
member.summary: True if this an instance method that explicitly declares the type and name of its first parameter (the instance).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsAbstract
member.summary: True if the method does not provide an implementation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsAccessCheckedOnOverride
member.summary: True if the method can only be overridden when it is also accessible.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsAggressivelyInlined
member.summary: True if the the runtime is requested to inline this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsCil
member.summary: True if the method is implemented in the CLI Common Intermediate Language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsExternal
member.summary: True if the method has an external implementation (i.e. not supplied by this definition).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsForwardReference
member.summary: True if the method implementation is defined by another method definition (to be supplied at a later time).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsGeneric
member.summary: True if the method has generic parameters;

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsHiddenBySignature
member.summary: True if this method is hidden if a derived type declares a method with the same name and signature. If false, any method with the same name hides this method. This flag is ignored by the runtime and is only used by compilers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsNativeCode
member.summary: True if the method is implemented in native (platform-specific) code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsNewSlot
member.summary: The method always gets a new slot in the virtual method table. This means the method will hide (not override) a base type method with the same name and signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsNeverInlined
member.summary: True if the the runtime is not allowed to inline this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsNeverOptimized
member.summary: True if the runtime is not allowed to optimize this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsPlatformInvoke
member.summary: True if the method is implemented via the invocation of an underlying platform method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsRuntimeImplemented
member.summary: True if the implementation of this method is supplied by the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsRuntimeInternal
member.summary: True if the method is an internal part of the runtime and must be called in a special way.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: True if the method gets special treatment from the runtime. For example, it might be a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsSealed
member.summary: True if the method may not be overridden.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsSpecialName
member.summary: True if the method is special in some way for tools. For example, it might be a property getter or setter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsStatic
member.summary: True if the method does not require an instance of its declaring type as its first argument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsSynchronized
member.summary: True if only one thread at a time may execute this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsVirtual
member.summary: True if the method may be overridden (or if it is an override).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsUnmanaged
member.summary: True if the implementation of this method is not managed by the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.Parameters
member.summary: The parameters forming part of this signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.ParameterCount
member.summary: The number of required parameters of the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.PreserveSignature
member.summary: True if the method signature must not be mangled during the interoperation with COM code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.RequiresSecurityObject
member.summary: True if the method calls another method containing security code. If this flag is set, the method should have System.Security.DynamicSecurityMethodAttribute present in its list of custom attributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.ReturnValueAttributes
member.summary: Custom attributes associated with the method's return value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.ReturnValueCustomModifiers
member.summary: Returns the list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the returned value. Evaluate this property only if ReturnValueIsModified is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.ReturnValueIsByRef
member.summary: True if the return value is passed by reference (using a managed pointer).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.ReturnValueIsMarshalledExplicitly
member.summary: The return value has associated marshalling information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.ReturnValueIsModified
member.summary: True if the return value has one or more custom modifiers associated with it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.ReturnValueMarshallingInformation
member.summary: Specifies how the return value is marshalled when the method is called from unmanaged code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.ReturnValueName
member.summary: The name of the parameter to which the return value is marshalled. Returns Dummy.Name if the name has not been specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.SecurityAttributes
member.summary: Declarative security actions for this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.Type
member.summary: The return type of the method or type of the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsConstructor
member.summary: True if the method is a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.IsStaticConstructor
member.summary: True if the method is a static constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FunctionPointerMethod.PlatformInvokeData
member.summary: Detailed information about the PInvoke stub. Identifies which method to call, which module has the method and the calling convention among other things.

member.summary: The type definition that contains this member.

member.summary: The number of generic parameters of the method. Zero if the referenced method is not generic.

member.summary: Indicates if the member is public or confined to its containing type, derived types and/or declaring assembly.

member.summary: A collection of metadata custom attributes that are associated with this definition.

member.summary: The parameters forming part of this signature.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.GetAttributes
member.summary: Returns a list of custom attributes that describes this type declaration member. Typically, these will be derived from this.SourceAttributes. However, some source attributes might instead be persisted as metadata bits and other custom attributes may be synthesized from information not provided in the form of source custom attributes. The list is not trimmed to size, since an override of this method may call the base method and then add more attributes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IDoubleDispatcher. The dispatch method does not invoke Dispatch on any child objects. If child traversal is desired, the implementations of the Visit methods should do the subsequent dispatching.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model reference node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IDoubleDispatcher. The dispatch method does not invoke Dispatch on any child objects. If child traversal is desired, the implementations of the Visit methods should do the subsequent dispatching.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.UsesToImplementAnInterfaceMethod(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition)
member.summary: True if this type uses the specified method to implement an interface method.
member.param: The method to check.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.GetBaseMembers
member.summary: Needed because base.Members cannot be referred to directly from inside an iterator.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.Alignment
member.summary: The byte alignment that values of the given type ought to have. Must be a power of 2. If zero, the alignment is decided at runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of metadata custom attributes that are associated with this definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.BaseClasses
member.summary: Zero or more classes from which this type is derived. For CLR types this collection is empty for interfaces and System.Object and populated with exactly one base type for all other types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.ExplicitImplementationOverrides
member.summary: Zero or more implementation overrides provided by the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.GenericParameters
member.summary: Zero or more parameters that can be used as type annotations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.GenericParameterCount
member.summary: The number of generic parameters. Zero if the type is not generic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.MangleName
member.summary: True if the type name must be mangled with the generic parameter count when emitting it to a PE file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.Interfaces
member.summary: Zero or more interfaces implemented by this type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.InstanceType
member.summary: An instance of this generic type that has been obtained by using the generic parameters as the arguments. Use this instance to look up members

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsAbstract
member.summary: True if the type may not be instantiated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsClass
member.summary: True if the type is a class (it is not an interface or type parameter and does not extend a special base class). Corresponds to C# class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsDelegate
member.summary: True if the type is a delegate (it extends System.MultiCastDelegate). Corresponds to C# delegate

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsEnum
member.summary: True if the type is an enumeration (it extends System.Enum and is sealed). Corresponds to C# enum.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsGeneric
member.summary: True if this type is parameterized (this.GenericParameters is a non empty collection).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsInterface
member.summary: True if the type is an interface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsReferenceType
member.summary: True if the type is a reference type. A reference type is non static class or interface or a suitably constrained type parameter. A type parameter for which MustBeReferenceType (the class constraint in C#) is true returns true for this property as does a type parameter with a constraint that is a class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsSealed
member.summary: True if the type may not be subtyped.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsStatic
member.summary: True if the type is an abstract sealed class that directly extends System.Object and declares no constructors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.HasExtensionMethod
member.summary: True if this type contains one or more extension method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsValueType
member.summary: True if the type is a value type. Value types are sealed and extend System.ValueType or System.Enum. A type parameter for which MustBeValueType (the struct constraint in C#) is true also returns true for this property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsStruct
member.summary: True if the type is a struct (its not Primitive, is sealed and base is System.ValueType).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.Name
member.summary: The name of the type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.PlatformType
member.summary: A collection of well known types that must be part of every target platform and that are fundamental to modeling compiled code. The types are obtained by querying the unit set of the compilation and thus can include types that are defined by the compilation itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.PrivateHelperMembers
member.summary: Zero or more private type members generated by the compiler for implementation purposes. These members are only available after a complete visit of all of the other members of the type, including the bodies of methods.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.SecurityAttributes
member.summary: Declarative security actions for this type. Will be empty if this.HasSecurity is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.SizeOf
member.summary: Size of an object of this type. In bytes. If zero, the size is unspecified and will be determined at runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.TypeCode
member.summary: Unless the value of TypeCode is PrimitiveTypeCode.NotPrimitive, the type corresponds to a "primitive" CLR type (such as System.Int32) and the type code identifies which of the primitive types it corresponds to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.TypeDeclarations
member.summary: A list of the type declarations that collectively define this type definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.UnderlyingType
member.summary: Returns a reference to the underlying (integral) type on which this (enum) type is based.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.Layout
member.summary: Layout of the type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsSpecialName
member.summary: True if the type has special name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsComObject
member.summary: Is this imported from COM type library

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsSerializable
member.summary: True if this type is serializable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsBeforeFieldInit
member.summary: Is type initialized anytime before first access to static field

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.StringFormat
member.summary: Default marshalling of the Strings in this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: True if this type gets special treatment from the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.HasDeclarativeSecurity
member.summary: True if this type has a non empty collection of SecurityAttributes or the System.Security.SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurityAttribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.Events
member.summary: Zero or more events defined by this type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.Fields
member.summary: Zero or more fields defined by this type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.Members
member.summary: The collection of member instances that are members of this scope.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.Methods
member.summary: Zero or more methods defined by this type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.NestedTypes
member.summary: Zero or more nested types defined by this type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.Properties
member.summary: Zero or more properties defined by this type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsAlias
member.summary: Indicates if this type reference resolved to an alias rather than a type

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.AliasForType
member.summary: Gives the alias for the type

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.CustomModifiers
member.summary: The list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the parameter. Evaluate this property only if IsModified is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.IsModified
member.summary: This type has one or more custom modifiers associated with it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.ResolvedType
member.summary: The type definition being referred to. In case this type was alias, this is also the type of the aliased type

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.InternFactory
member.summary: A collection of methods that associate unique integers with metadata model entities. The association is based on the identities of the entities and the factory does not retain references to the given metadata model objects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.InternedKey
member.summary: Returns the unique interned key associated with the type. This takes unification/aliases/custom modifiers into account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamedTypeDefinition.Flags.HasExtensionMethod
member.summary: This type contains at least one definition method.

member.summary: If the given generic parameter is a generic parameter of the generic method of which the given method is an instance, then return the corresponding type argument that was used to create the method instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameter.SpecializeIfConstructedFromApplicableTypeParameter(Microsoft.Cci.IGenericParameter,Microsoft.Cci.IGenericTypeInstanceReference)
member.summary: If the given generic parameter is a generic parameter of the generic type of which the given type is an instance, then return the corresponding type argument that was used to create the type instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameter.GetDeclarations
member.summary: Returns the list of generic parameter declarations that collectively define this generic parameter definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameter.BaseClasses
member.summary: Gets the base classes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameter.Constraints
member.summary: A list of classes or interfaces. All type arguments matching this parameter must be derived from all of the classes and implement all of the interfaces.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameter.Index
member.summary: The position in the parameter list where this instance can be found.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameter.IsReferenceType
member.summary: True if the type is a reference type. A reference type is non static class or interface or a suitably constrained type parameter. A type parameter for which MustBeReferenceType (the class constraint in C#) is true returns true for this property as does a type parameter with a constraint that is a class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GenericParameter.IsValueType
member.summary: True if the type is a value type. Value types are sealed and extend System.ValueType or System.Enum. A type parameter for which MustBeValueType (the struct constraint in C#) is true also returns true for this property.

member.summary: True if all type arguments matching this parameter are constrained to be reference types.

member.summary: True if all type arguments matching this parameter are constrained to be value types.

member.summary: Returns the list of generic parameter declarations that collectively define this generic parameter definition.

member.summary: The generic method that defines this type parameter.

member.summary: A collection of well known types that must be part of every target platform and that are fundamental to modeling compiled code. The types are obtained by querying the unit set of the compilation and thus can include types that are defined by the compilation itself.

member.summary: Adds an additional global field declaration to the list of declarations that aggregate into this definition. Does nothting if the declaration is already a member of the list.

member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(IGlobalFieldDefinition) method.

member.summary: Gets the global field declaration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of metadata custom attributes that are associated with this definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.BitLength
member.summary: The number of least significant bits that form part of the value of the field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.CompileTimeValue
member.summary: The compile time value of the field. This value should be used directly in IL, rather than a reference to the field. If the field does not have a valid compile time value, an instance of DummyConstant is returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.ContainingNamespace
member.summary: The namespace that contains this member.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.ContainingType
member.summary: The type reference of the containing type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.ContainingTypeDefinition
member.summary: The type definition that contains this member.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.CustomModifiers
member.summary: The list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the field. Evaluate this property only if IsModified is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.GlobalFieldDeclaration
member.summary: The global field declaration that projects onto this global field definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.FieldMapping
member.summary: Information of the location where this field is mapped to

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.GlobalFieldDeclarations
member.summary: Gets the global field declarations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.InternedKey
member.summary: Returns a key that is computed from the information in this reference and that distinguishes this.ResolvedField from all other fields obtained from the same metadata host.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.IsBitField
member.summary: The field is aligned on a bit boundary and uses only the BitLength number of least significant bits of the representation of a Type value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.IsCompileTimeConstant
member.summary: This field is a compile-time constant. The field has no runtime location and cannot be directly addressed from IL.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.IsMapped
member.summary: This field is mapped to an explicitly initialized (static) memory location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.IsMarshalledExplicitly
member.summary: This field has associated field marshalling information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.IsModified
member.summary: This field has custom modifiers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.IsNotSerialized
member.summary: The field does not have to be serialized when its containing instance is serialized.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.IsReadOnly
member.summary: This field can only be read. Initialization takes place in a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.IsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: This field has a special name reserved for the internal use of the Common Language Runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.IsSpecialName
member.summary: This field is special in some way, as specified by the name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.IsStatic
member.summary: This field is static (shared by all instances of its declaring type).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.Locations
member.summary: A potentially empty collection of locations that correspond to this IGlobalFieldDefinition instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.MarshallingInformation
member.summary: Specifies how this field is marshalled when it is accessed from unmanaged code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.Name
member.summary: The name of the global field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.Offset
member.summary: Offset of the field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.SequenceNumber
member.summary: The position of the field starting from 0 within the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.Type
member.summary: The type of value that is stored in this field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalFieldDefinition.Visibility
member.summary: Indicates if the member is public or confined to its containing type, derived types and/or declaring assembly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.GlobalMethodDefinition
member.summary: Represents a global method in symbol table.

member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(IMethodDefinition) method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(IMethodReference) method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.AcceptsExtraArguments
member.summary: True if the call sites that references the method with this object supply extra arguments.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.Body
member.summary: A container for a list of IL instructions providing the implementation (if any) of this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.CallingConvention
member.summary: Calling convention of the signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.Declaration
member.summary: The declaration that corresponds to this definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.EmptyCollection
member.summary: An empty collection of method definitions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.GenericParameters
member.summary: If the method is generic then this list contains the type parameters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.GenericParameterCount
member.summary: The number of generic parameters of the method. Zero if the referenced method is not generic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.HasDeclarativeSecurity
member.summary: True if this method has a non empty collection of SecurityAttributes or the System.Security.SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurityAttribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.HasExplicitThisParameter
member.summary: True if this is an instance method that explicitly declares the type and name of its first parameter (the instance).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.ImplementedInterfaces
member.summary: A list of interfaces whose corresponding abstract methods are implemented by this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.InternedKey
member.summary: Returns a key that is computed from the information in this reference and that uniquely identifies this.ResolvedMethod.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsAbstract
member.summary: True if the method does not provide an implementation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsAccessCheckedOnOverride
member.summary: True if the method can only be overridden when it is also accessible.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsAggressivelyInlined
member.summary: True if the the runtime is requested to inline this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsCil
member.summary: True if the method is implemented in the CLI Common Intermediate Language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsExternal
member.summary: True if the method has an external implementation (i.e. not supplied by this definition).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsForwardReference
member.summary: True if the method implementation is defined by another method definition (to be supplied at a later time).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsGeneric
member.summary: True if the method has generic parameters;

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsHiddenBySignature
member.summary: True if this method is hidden if a derived type declares a method with the same name and signature. If false, any method with the same name hides this method. This flag is ignored by the runtime and is only used by compilers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsNativeCode
member.summary: True if the method is implemented in native (platform-specific) code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsNewSlot
member.summary: The method always gets a new slot in the virtual method table. This means the method will hide (not override) a base type method with the same name and signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsNeverInlined
member.summary: True if the the runtime is not allowed to inline this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsNeverOptimized
member.summary: True if the runtime is not allowed to optimize this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsPlatformInvoke
member.summary: True if the method is implemented via the invocation of an underlying platform method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsRuntimeImplemented
member.summary: True if the implementation of this method is supplied by the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsRuntimeInternal
member.summary: True if the method is an internal part of the runtime and must be called in a special way.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: True if the method gets special treatment from the runtime. For example, it might be a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsSealed
member.summary: True if the method may not be overridden.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsSpecialName
member.summary: True if the method is special in some way for tools. For example, it might be a property getter or setter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsStatic
member.summary: True if the method does not require an instance of its declaring type as its first argument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsExtensionMethod
member.summary: True if this method is a static method that can be called as an instance method on another class because it has an explicit this parameter. In other words, the class defining this static method is effectively extending another class, but doing so without subclassing it and without requiring client code to instantiate the subclass.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsSynchronized
member.summary: True if only one thread at a time may execute this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsVirtual
member.summary: True if the method may be overridden (or if it is an override).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsUnmanaged
member.summary: True if the implementation of this method is not managed by the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.Name
member.summary: The name of the entity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.PreserveSignature
member.summary: True if the method signature must not be mangled during the interoperation with COM code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.RequiresSecurityObject
member.summary: True if the method calls another method containing security code. If this flag is set, the method should have System.Security.DynamicSecurityMethodAttribute present in its list of custom attributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueAttributes
member.summary: Custom attributes associated with the method's return value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueCustomModifiers
member.summary: Returns the list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the returned value. Evaluate this property only if ReturnValueIsModified is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueIsByRef
member.summary: True if the return value is passed by reference (using a managed pointer).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueIsModified
member.summary: True if the return value has one or more custom modifiers associated with it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueIsMarshalledExplicitly
member.summary: The return value has associated marshalling information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueMarshallingInformation
member.summary: Specifies how the return value is marshalled when the method is called from unmanaged code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueName
member.summary: The name of the parameter to which the return value is marshalled. Returns Dummy.Name if the name has not been specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.SecurityAttributes
member.summary: Declarative security actions for this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.Parameters
member.summary: The parameters of this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.ParameterCount
member.summary: The number of required parameters of the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.Type
member.summary: The return type of the method or type of the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsConstructor
member.summary: True if the method is a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.IsStaticConstructor
member.summary: True if the method is a static constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.PlatformInvokeData
member.summary: Detailed information about the PInvoke stub. Identifies which method to call, which module has the method and the calling convention among other things.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.ResolvedMethod
member.summary: The method being referred to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodDefinition.ExtraParameters
member.summary: Information about this types of the extra arguments supplied at the call sites that references the method with this object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodBody.GetIteratorScopes
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes, each defining an IL range in which an iterator local is defined. The scopes are returned by the MoveNext method of the object returned by the iterator method. The index of the scope corresponds to the index of the local. Specifically local scope i corresponds to the local stored in field <localName>x_i of the class used to store the local values in between calls to MoveNext.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodBody.GetLocalScopes
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes into which the CLR IL operations in the given method body is organized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MethodBody.GetNamespaceScopes
member.summary: Returns zero or more namespace scopes into which the namespace type containing the given method body has been nested. These scopes determine how simple names are looked up inside the method body. There is a separate scope for each dotted component in the namespace type name. For istance namespace type x.y.z will have two namespace scopes, the first is for the x and the second is for the y.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MarshallingInformation
member.summary: When managed code calls unmanaged methods or exposes managed fields to unmanaged code, it is sometimes necessary to provide specific information about how the managed types should be marshalled to and from the unmanaged types.

members.member:
When managed code calls unmanaged methods or exposes managed fields to unmanaged code, it is sometimes necessary to provide specific information about how the managed types should be marshalled to and from the unmanaged types.
The unmanaged type to which the managed type will be marshalled. This can be be UnmanagedType.CustomMarshaler, in which case the umanaged type is decided at runtime.
The unmanged element type of the unmanaged array.
The size of an element of the fixed sized umanaged array.
A multiplier that must be applied to the value of the parameter specified by ParamIndex in order to work out the total size of the unmanaged array.
Specifies the index of the parameter that contains the value of the Inteface Identifier (IID) of the marshalled object.
The number of elements in the fixed size portion of the unmanaged array.
The zero based index of the parameter in the unmanaged method that contains the number of elements in the variable portion of unmanaged array. If the index is null, the variable portion is of size zero, or the caller conveys the size of the variable portion of the array to the unmanaged method in some other way.
The type to which the variant values of all elements of the safe array must belong. See also SafeArrayElementUserDefinedSubType. (The element type of a safe array is VARIANT. The "sub type" specifies the value of all of the tag fields (vt) of the element values. )
A reference to the user defined type to which the variant values of all elements of the safe array must belong. (The element type of a safe array is VARIANT. The tag fields will all be either VT_DISPATCH or VT_UNKNOWN or VT_RECORD. The "user defined sub type" specifies the type of value the ppdispVal/ppunkVal/pvRecord fields of the element values may point to.) May be null if the above does not apply.
A reference to the type implementing the custom marshaller. Must not be be null if unmanagedType == System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType.CustomMarshaler.
An argument string (cookie) passed to the custom marshaller at run time. Must not be be null if unmanagedType == System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType.CustomMarshaler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MarshallingInformation.CustomMarshaller
member.summary: A reference to the type implementing the custom marshaller.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MarshallingInformation.CustomMarshallerRuntimeArgument
member.summary: An argument string (cookie) passed to the custom marshaller at run time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MarshallingInformation.ElementSize
member.summary: The size of an element of the fixed sized umanaged array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MarshallingInformation.ElementType
member.summary: The unmanged element type of the unmanaged array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MarshallingInformation.IidParameterIndex
member.summary: Specifies the index of the parameter that contains the value of the Inteface Identifier (IID) of the marshalled object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MarshallingInformation.UnmanagedType
member.summary: The unmanaged type to which the managed type will be marshalled. This can be be UnmanagedType.CustomMarshaler, in which case the umanaged type is decided at runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MarshallingInformation.NumberOfElements
member.summary: The number of elements in the fixed size portion of the unmanaged array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MarshallingInformation.ParamIndex
member.summary: The zero based index of the parameter in the unmanaged method that contains the number of elements in the variable portion of unmanaged array. If the index is null, the variable portion is of size zero, or the caller conveys the size of the variable portion of the array to the unmanaged method in some other way.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MarshallingInformation.SafeArrayElementSubtype
member.summary: The type to which the variant values of all elements of the safe array must belong. See also SafeArrayElementUserDefinedSubType. (The element type of a safe array is VARIANT. The "sub type" specifies the value of all of the tag fields (vt) of the element values. )

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MarshallingInformation.SafeArrayElementUserDefinedSubtype
member.summary: A reference to the user defined type to which the variant values of all elements of the safe array must belong. (The element type of a safe array is VARIANT. The tag fields will all be either VT_DISPATCH or VT_UNKNOWN or VT_RECORD. The "user defined sub type" specifies the type of value the ppdispVal/ppunkVal/pvRecord fields of the element values may point to.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.MarshallingInformation.ElementSizeMultiplier
member.summary: A multiplier that must be applied to the value of the parameter specified by ParamIndex in order to work out the total size of the unmanaged array.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SourceCustomAttribute.flags
member.summary: Holds a bit (0x4000000) that indicates that the attribute usage attribute has already been inspected, a bit (0x20000000) that indicates that AllowMultiple is true, a bit (0x10000000) that indicates that Inherited is true and stores the value of ValidOn in the lower order bits.

member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct a custom attribute before constructing the container for the attribute. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.summary: Performs any error checks still needed and returns true if any errors were found in the alias or a constituent part of the alias. Do not call this method directly, but evaluate the HasErrors property. The latter will cache the return value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.AliasDeclaration.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SourceVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(AliasDeclaration) method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.AliasDeclaration.MakeShallowCopyFor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration)
member.summary: Returns a shallow copy of this namespace declarations member with the given namespace declaration as the containing namespace of the copy.
member.param: The namespace declaration that is to be the containing namespace of the copy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.AliasDeclaration.SetContainingNamespaceDeclaration(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct a namespace member before constructing the namespace. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.
member.param: The containing namespace declaration.
True if the method should be called recursively on members of nested namespace declarations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.AliasDeclaration.ReferencedNamespaceOrType
member.summary: An expression that, if correct, resolves to an INamespace instance or an ITypeDefinition instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.AliasDeclaration.ResolvedNamespaceOrType
member.summary: Resolves the ReferencedNamespaceOrType expression. If the expression fails to resolve an error is generated and a dummy namespace is returned.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration
member.summary: Represents a namespace construct as found in the source code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.CheckForErrorsAndReturnTrueIfAnyAreFound
member.summary: Performs any error checks still needed and returns true if any errors were found in the member or a constituent part of the member. Do not call this method directly, but evaluate the HasErrors property. The latter will cache the return value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.GetAttributes
member.summary: Returns a list of custom attributes that describes this type declaration member. Typically, these will be derived from this.SourceAttributes. However, some source attributes might instead be persisted as metadata bits and other custom attributes may be synthesized from information not provided in the form of source custom attributes. The list is not trimmed to size, since an override of this method may call the base method and then add more attributes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.BusyResolvingAnAliasOrImport
member.summary: If this is true, the alias declarations and namespace imports of this namespace declaration must be ignored when resolving simple names.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SourceVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(NamespaceDeclaration) method.

member.summary: Returns the IAliasDeclaration or IUnitSetAliasDeclaration, if any, with the given name, ignoring the case of the name if so instructed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.GetApplicableExtensionMethods(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition},Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SimpleName,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression})
member.summary: Find a method group that is accessible and applicable for the given simple name and argument list. If no methods found go to enclosing namespaces.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.GetExtensionMethodsFromDirectlyEnclosedTypes(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition},Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SimpleName,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression})
member.summary: All the applicable methods found in ALL directly enclosed classes are aggregated into result method group.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.GetExtensionMethodsViaUsingDirectives(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition},Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SimpleName,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Expression})
member.summary: All the applicable methods found in ALL directly enclosed classes in ALL of the included namespaces are aggregated into the result method group.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.InitializeIfNecessary
member.summary: If this namespace declaration has not yet been initialized, parse the source, set the containing nodes of the result and report any scanning and parsing errors via the host environment. This method is called whenever

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.members
member.summary: A list of members that are either supplied as an argument during construction or later filled in via a method in the derived class. If InitializeIfNecessary is called, it must leave this field non null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.methodBodyThatWillProvideNonEmptyNamespaceScopes
member.summary: Only one method body per namespace declaration needs to write out PDB information about the used namespaces. This field tracks which body takes on that role. Initially, it is null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.SetContainingNodes
member.summary: Completes the two part construction of the namespace declaration by setting the containing nodes of all of the nodes contained directly or indirectly inside this namespace declaration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.UpdateMembers(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Cci.Ast.INamespaceDeclarationMember},Microsoft.Cci.ISourceDocumentEdit)
member.summary: This method is called when one of the members of this namespace declaration has been updated because of an edit. It returns a new namespace declaration object that is the same as this declaration, except that one of its members is different. Since all of the members have a ContainingNamespaceDeclaration property that should point to the new namespace declaration object, each of the members in the list (except the new one) will be shallow copied and reparented as soon as they are accessed.
member.remarks: The current implementation makes shallow copies of all members as soon as any one of them is accessed because all ways of accessing a particular member involves evaluating the Members property, which returns all members and hence has no choice but to make the copies up front. This not too great a disaster since the copies are shallow.
member.param: A new list of members, where all of the elements are the same as the elements of this.members, except for the member that has been updated, which appears in the list as an updated member.
The edit that caused all of the trouble. This is used to update the source location of the resulting namespace declaration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.Aliases
member.summary: A collection of the members, if any, of this namespace that are namespace or type alias declarations. These correspond to the using id = ... clauses that can follow a C# namespace declaration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.Compilation
member.summary: The compilation to which this namespace declaration belongs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.CompilationPart
member.summary: The compilation part that contains this namespace declaration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.DummyBlock
member.summary: A block statement that serves as the declaring block of any expressions that form part of the the namespace declaration but that do not appear inside a method body.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.HasErrors
member.summary: Checks the namespace for errors and returns true if any were found.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.Helper
member.summary: An instance of a language specific class containing methods that are of general utility.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.Imports
member.summary: A collection of the members, if any, of this namespace that are namespace import declarations. These correspond to the using clauses that can follow a C# namespace declaration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.Members
member.summary: The members of this namespace declaration. Members can include things such as types, nested namespaces, alias declarations, and so on.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.Scope
member.summary: A scope containing all of the members in the associated namespace as well as all of the members of any namespaces imported by the namespace declaration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.UnitNamespace

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration.UnitSetAliases

The name of a namepace that has been aliased. For example the "y.z" of "using x = y.z;" or "using y.z" in C#.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UsedNamespace.NamespaceName

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.OptionDeclaration.CompareStringsAsBinary
member.summary: If true, strings are compared by doing binary comparisons between the character elements.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RootNamespaceDeclaration
member.summary: An AST node for the anonymous (outermost) namespace of a compilation part. This declaration object is aggregrated with the root namespaces of each of the other compilation parts to jointly project onto a single IRootUnitNamespace object. The latter object is the one that gets persisted into the resulting assembly and that constitutes the symbol table that is consulted when analyzing the AST nodes. The aggregated namespace is available via the UnitNamespace property.

The members of this namespace declaration. Members can include things such as types, nested namespaces, alias declarations, and so on.
The location in the source that corresponds to this declaration object.
member.remarks: Called when the compilation part already exists. This happens when a source document is parsed for the first time, as the result of a top down traversal of a compilation.

member.summary: Makes this namespace declaration the parent of the nested namespaces and namespace types that are contained within this namespace declaration.

It returns a new namespace declaration object that is the same as this declaration, except that one of its members is different. Since all of the members have a ContainingNamespaceDeclaration property that should point to the new namespace declaration object, each of the members in the list (except the new one) will be shallow copied and reparented as soon as they are accessed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RootNamespaceDeclaration.CompilationPart
member.summary: The compilation part for which this is the root namespace declaration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RootNamespaceDeclaration.DummyBlock
member.summary: A block statement that provides an evaluation environment for any expressions that form part of members of the namespace declaration. For example, the initial values of global field declarations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RootNamespaceDeclaration.Explicit
member.summary: If true, all variables used inside this namespace should be declared explicitly. This corresponds to the Option explicit directive in VB.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RootNamespaceDeclaration.Strict
member.summary: If true, type annotations must be present and all operations must resolve at compile time inside this namespace declaration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RootNamespaceDeclaration.UnitNamespace
member.summary: The single namespace definition that aggregates all of the members of the root namespace declarations of all of the compilation parts of this compilation. In effect this is the root of the symbol table for this compilation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.RootNamespaceDeclaration.UnitSetNamespace
member.summary: The root namepace of the unit set associated with the compilation that contains this namespace declaration. In effect this is the root of a symbol table that includes all of the symbols imported from external libraries (assemblies).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnitSetAliasDeclaration

The IUnit instance associated with this namespace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.UnitNamespace.AddNamespaceDeclaration(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NamespaceDeclaration)

member.summary: Populate the given list with all of the assembly attributes in this namespace and its nested namespaces. If sawTypeExtensions is false, also look for any types in this namespace and its nested namespaces that have the HasExtensionMethod property set to true and set sawTypeExtensions to true if such a type is found.
member.param: A list to fill in with the assembly attributes in this namespace.

member.summary: Initializes an executable statement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Statement.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement,Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Statement)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Statement.MakeCopyFor(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement)
member.summary: Makes a copy of this statement, changing the ContainingBlock to the given block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Statement.SetContainingBlock(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct a Statement before constructing the containing Block. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Statement.Compilation
member.summary: The compilation that contains this statement.

member.summary: The compilation part that contains this statement.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Statement.ContainingBlock
member.summary: The block in which this statement is nested. If the statement is the outer most block of a method, then the containing block is itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Statement.Helper
member.summary: An instance of a language specific class containing methods that are of general utility.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Statement.NameTable
member.summary: A table used to intern strings used as names. This table is obtained from the host environment. It is mutuable, in as much as it is possible to add new names to the table.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Statement.PlatformType
member.summary: A collection of well known types that must be part of every target platform and that are fundamental to modeling compiled code. The types are obtained by querying the unit set of the compilation and thus can include types that are defined by the compilation itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.AssertStatement.Condition
member.summary: A condition that must be true when execution reaches this statement.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.AssertStatement.Description
member.summary: An optional expression that is associated with the assertion. Generally, it would be a message that was written at the same time as the contract and is meant to be used as a description when the contract fails.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.AssertStatement.OriginalSource
member.summary: The original source representation of the assertion.
member.remarks: Normally this would be extracted directly from the source file. The expectation is that one would translate the Condition into a source string in a source language appropriate for the particular tool environment, e.g., when doing static analysis, in the language the client code uses, not the language the contract was written.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.AssertStatement.ConvertedCondition
member.summary: The condition that must be true at the start of the method that is associated with this Precondition instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.AssertStatement.HasBeenVerified
member.summary: True if a static verification tool has determined that the condition will always be true when execution reaches this statement.

member.summary: The method definition, if any, that contains this statement block. This can be null if this statement block is part of an anonymous delegate or lambda expression that is used to initialize a field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement.ContainingNamespaceDeclaration
member.summary: The namespace declaration that contains this statement block.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement.ContainingSignatureDeclaration
member.summary: The signature declaration (such as a lambda, method, property or anonymous method) that contains this statement block. This can be null if this is a dummy block associated with a type declaration or namespace declaration.

member.summary: The type declaration that contains this statement block.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement.Scope
member.summary: The scope defined by this block.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement.SingletonStatement
member.summary: If the block contains a single executable statement, that statement is returned. Otherwise null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement.Statements
member.summary: The statements making up the block.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement.UseCheckedArithmetic
member.summary: True if, by default, all arithmetic expressions in the block must be checked for overflow. This setting is inherited by nested blocks and can be overridden by nested blocks and expressions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement.Options
member.summary: Values that indicate if a block is checked/unchecked and safe/unsafe or whether it inherits these settings from its containing block or from a compilation option.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement.Options.Default
member.summary: The block inherits its checked/unchecked and safe/unsafe setting from its parent. If there is no parent, the checked/unchecked setting is determined by a compilation option.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement.Options.AllowUnsafeCode
member.summary: Code inside the block can contain unsafe constructs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement.Options.UseCheckedArithmetic
member.summary: Arithmetic operations inside this block throw an exception if overflow occurs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement.Options.UseUncheckedArithmetic
member.summary: Arithmetic operations inside this block silently overflow.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.DisableOnErrorHandler
member.summary: Disables the error handler set up by the last "On Error ..." statement executed in the method containing this statement. Should an exception occur after executing this statement and before executing another "On Error ..." statement, exceptions that would have been handled by the disabled error handler will now cause the method to be terminated and the exception to be passed on to the caller.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.DisableOnErrorHandler.CheckForErrorsAndReturnTrueIfAnyAreFound
member.summary: Performs any error checks still needed and returns true if any errors were found in the statement or a constituent part of the statement. Do not call this method directly, but call the HasErrors method. The latter will cache the return value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.DisableOnErrorHandler.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.ICodeVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(xxxxx) method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.DisableOnErrorHandler.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.SourceVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(DisableOnErrorHandler) method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldInitializerStatement
member.summary: A statement that has no source equivalent and that serves as a marker for the place where a constructor should have assignment statements to initialize instance fields that have explicit initial value expressions. In C#, this initialization happens before the base class constructor is called, which happens before any of the explicit code in the constructor is executed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.FieldInitializerStatement.#ctor
member.summary: Allocates a statement that has no source equivalent and that serves as a marker for the place where a constructor should have assignment statements to initialize instance fields that have explicit initial value expressions. In C#, this initialization happens before the base class constructor is called, which happens before any of the explicit code in the constructor is executed.

member.summary: Represents a using statement block (of one or more IDisposable resources).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ResourceUseStatement.CheckForErrorsAndReturnTrueIfAnyAreFound
member.summary: Performs any error checks still needed and returns true if any errors were found in the statement or a constituent part of the statement. Do not call this method directly, but call the HasErrors method. The latter will cache the return value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ResourceUseStatement.CreateDummyBlock
member.summary: Creates a new dummy block that provides a scope for the acquired resources.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ResourceUseStatement.SetContainingBlock(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.BlockStatement)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct a Statement before constructing the containing Block. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct a Statement before constructing the containing Block. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclaration.GetFieldOffset(System.Object)
member.summary: Compute the offset of its field. For example, a struct in C and a union will have different say about its field's offset.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclaration.GetAttributes
member.summary: Returns a list of custom attributes that describes this type declaration member. Typically, these will be derived from this.SourceAttributes. However, some source attributes might instead be persisted as metadata bits and other custom attributes may be synthesized from information not provided in the form of source custom attributes. The list is not trimmed to size, since an override of this method may call the base method and then add more attributes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclaration.CanAccess(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinitionMember)
member.summary: True if the given type member may be accessed by this type declaration. For example, if the member is private and this is that same as the containing type of the member, or is a nested type of the containing type of the member, the result is true.
member.param: The type member to check.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclaration.CanAccess(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: True if the given type may be accessed from the scope defined by this block. For example, if the type is private nested type and this block is defined inside a method of the containing type of the member, the result is true.
member.param: The type to check.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclaration.CanAccess(Microsoft.Cci.INamespaceDefinition)
member.summary: True if the given namespace, or one of its descendant namespaces, contains a type that can be accessed from the scope defined by this block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.NestedDelegateDeclaration.SetContainingTypeDeclaration(Microsoft.Cci.Ast.TypeDeclaration,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Completes the two stage construction of this object. This allows bottom up parsers to construct a type member before constructing the containing type declaration. This method should be called once only and must be called before this object is made available to client code. The construction code itself should also take care not to call any other methods or property/event accessors on the object until after this method has been called.
member.param: The type declaration that contains this nested type declaration.
True if the construction of the children of this node need to be completed as well.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly
member.summary: Represents a .NET assembly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module
member.summary: An object that represents a .NET module.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit
member.summary: A unit of metadata stored as a single artifact and potentially produced and revised independently from other units. Examples of units include .NET assemblies and modules, as well C++ object files and compiled headers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IName,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a unit of metadata stored as a single artifact and potentially produced and revised independently from other units. Examples of units include .NET assemblies and modules, as well C++ object files and compiled headers.
member.param: The name of the unit.

An indication of the location where the unit is or will be stored. This need not be a file system path and may be empty. The interpretation depends on the ICompilationHostEnviroment instance used to resolve references to this unit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IUnit).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IUnitReference).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.GetAttributes
member.summary: Returns a list of custom attributes that describes this type declaration member. Typically, these will be derived from this.SourceAttributes. However, some source attributes might instead be persisted as metadata bits and other custom attributes may be synthesized from information not provided in the form of source custom attributes. The list is not trimmed to size, since an override of this method may call the base method and then add more attributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.ContractAssemblySymbolicIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the assembly corresponding to the target platform contract assembly at the time this unit was compiled. This property will be used to implement IMetadataHost.ContractAssemblySymbolicIdentity and its implementation must consequently not use the latter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.CoreAssemblySymbolicIdentity
member.summary: An assembly reference corresponding to the target platform core assembly at the time this unit was compiled. This property will be used to implement IMetadataHost.CoreAssemblySymbolicIdentity and its implementation must consequently not use the latter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.Compilation
member.summary: The compilation that produces this unit of metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.Location
member.summary: An indication of the location where the unit is or will be stored. This need not be a file system path and may be empty. The interpretation depends on the ICompilationHostEnviroment instance used to resolve references to unit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.Name
member.summary: The name of the entity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.NameTable
member.summary: A table used to intern strings used as names. This table is obtained from the host environment. It is mutuable, in as much as it is possible to add new names to the table.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.PlatformType
member.summary: A collection of well known types that must be part of every target platform and that are fundamental to modeling compiled code. The types are obtained by querying the unit set of the compilation and thus can include types that are defined by the compilation itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.UnitNamespaceRoot
member.summary: A root namespace that contains nested namespaces as well as top level types and anything else that implements INamespaceMember.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.UnitReferences
member.summary: A list of other units that are referenced by this unit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.UnitIdentity
member.summary: Returns the identity of the unit reference.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.UninterpretedSections
member.summary: A sequence of PE sections that are not well known to PE readers and thus have not been decompiled into other parts of the Metadata Model. These sections may have meaning to other tools.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.ResolvedUnit
member.summary: The referenced unit, or Dummy.Unit if the reference cannot be resolved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of metadata custom attributes that are associated with this definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Unit.Locations
member.summary: A potentially empty collection of locations that correspond to this instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IName,System.String,Microsoft.Cci.IAssembly,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.IAssemblyReference},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.IModuleReference})
member.summary: Allocates an object that represents a .NET module.
