An indication of the location where the unit is or will be stored. This need not be a file system path and may be empty. The interpretation depends on the ICompilationHostEnviroment instance used to resolve references to this unit.
The assembly that contains this module.
A list of the assemblies that are referenced by this module.
A list of the modules that are referenced by this module.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.CreateRootNamespace
member.summary: Returns a root namepace object that is language specific.
member.remarks: Most languages will probably just use the base method, but some languages may want to allocate a root namespace that has added behavior that, for example, helps with language specific name lookup rules.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IModule).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IModuleReference).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.GetAttributes
member.summary: Returns a list of custom attributes that describes this type declaration member. Typically, these will be derived from this.SourceAttributes. However, some source attributes might instead be persisted as metadata bits and other custom attributes may be synthesized from information not provided in the form of source custom attributes. The list is not trimmed to size, since an override of this method may call the base method and then add more attributes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.GetStrings
member.summary: Returns zero or more strings used in the module. If the module is produced by reading in a CLR PE file, then this will be the contents of the user string heap. If the module is produced some other way, the method may return an empty enumeration or an enumeration that is a subset of the strings actually used in the module. The main purpose of this method is to provide a way to control the order of strings in a prefix of the user string heap when writing out a module as a PE file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.GetAllTypes
member.summary: Returns all of the types in the current module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.AssemblyReferences
member.summary: A list of the assemblies that are referenced by this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.BaseAddress
member.summary: The preferred memory address at which the module is to be loaded at runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.ContainingAssembly
member.summary: The assembly that contains this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.DebugInformationLocation
member.summary: A path to the debug information corresponding to this module. Can be absolute or relative to the file path of the module. Empty if not specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.DllCharacteristics
member.summary: Flags that control the behavior of the target operating system. CLI implementations are supposed to ignore this, but some operating system pay attention.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.EntryPoint
member.summary: The method that will be called to start execution of this executable module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.FileAlignment
member.summary: The alignment of sections in the module's image file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.ILOnly
member.summary: True if the module contains only IL and is processor independent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.Kind
member.summary: The kind of metadata stored in the module. For example whether the module is an executable or a manifest resource file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.LinkerMajorVersion
member.summary: The first part of a two part version number indicating the version of the linker that produced this module. For example, the 8 in 8.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.LinkerMinorVersion
member.summary: The first part of a two part version number indicating the version of the linker that produced this module. For example, the 0 in 8.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.Machine
member.summary: Specifies the target CPU.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.MetadataFormatMajorVersion
member.summary: The first part of a two part version number indicating the version of the format used to persist this module. For example, the 1 in 1.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.MetadataFormatMinorVersion
member.summary: The second part of a two part version number indicating the version of the format used to persist this module. For example, the 0 in 1.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.ModuleAttributes
member.summary: A list of objects representing persisted instances of types that extend System.Attribute. Provides an extensible way to associate metadata with this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.ModuleIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.ModuleName
member.summary: The name of the module. This can be different from the name if this module is also an assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.ModuleReferences
member.summary: A list of the modules that are referenced by this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.NativeEntryPoint
member.summary: True if the module has a native entry point.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.PersistentIdentifier
member.summary: A globally unique persistent identifier for this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.RequiresAmdInstructionSet
member.summary: If set, the module contains instructions or assumptions that are specific to the AMD 64 bit instruction set. Setting this flag to true also sets Requires64bits to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.Requires32bits
member.summary: If set, the module contains instructions that assume a 32 bit instruction set. For example it may depend on an address being 32 bits. This may be true even if the module contains only IL instructions because of PlatformInvoke and COM interop.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.Requires64bits
member.summary: If set, the module contains instructions that assume a 64 bit instruction set. For example it may depend on an address being 64 bits. This may be true even if the module contains only IL instructions because of PlatformInvoke and COM interop.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.RequiresStartupStub
member.summary: If set, the module must include a machine code stub that transfers control to the virtual execution system.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.SizeOfHeapCommit
member.summary: The size of the virtual memory initially committed for the initial process heap.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.SizeOfHeapReserve
member.summary: The size of the virtual memory to reserve for the initial process heap.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.SizeOfStackReserve
member.summary: The size of the virtual memory to reserve for the initial thread's stack.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.SizeOfStackCommit
member.summary: The size of the virtual memory initially committed for the initial thread's stack.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.StrongNameSigned
member.summary: True if the module contains a hash of its contents, encrypted with the private key of an assembly strong name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.TargetRuntimeVersion
member.summary: Identifies the version of the CLR that is required to load this module or assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.TrackDebugData
member.summary: True if the instructions in this module must be compiled in such a way that the debugging experience is not compromised. To set the value of this property, add an instance of System.Diagnostics.DebuggableAttribute to the MetadataAttributes list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.UnitIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the unit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.UnitNamespaceRoot
member.summary: A root namespace that contains nested namespaces as well as top level types and anything else that implements INamespaceMember.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.UnitReferences
member.summary: A list of other units that are referenced by this unit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.UsePublicKeyTokensForAssemblyReferences
member.summary: True if the module will be persisted with a list of assembly references that include only tokens derived from the public keys of the referenced assemblies, rather than with references that include the full public keys of referenced assemblies as well as hashes over the contents of the referenced assemblies. Setting this property to true is appropriate during development. When building for deployment it is safer to set this property to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Module.Win32Resources
member.summary: A list of named byte sequences persisted with the module and used during execution, typically via the Win32 API. A module will define Win32 resources rather than "managed" resources mainly to present metadata to legacy tools and not typically use the data in its own code.
Allocates an object that represents a .NET assembly.
member.param: The name of the unit.

An indication of the location where the unit is or will be stored. This need not be a file system path and may be empty. The interpretation depends on the IMetadataHost instance used to resolve references to this unit.
The name of the module containing the assembly manifest. This can be different from the name of the assembly itself.
A list of the assemblies that are referenced by this module.
A list of the modules that are referenced by this module.
A list of named byte sequences persisted with the assembly and used during execution, typically via .NET Framework helper classes.

A list of the files that constitute the assembly. These are not the source language files that may have been used to compile the assembly, but the files that contain constituent modules of a multi-module assembly as well as any external resources. It corresonds to the File table of the .NET assembly file format.

member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IAssembly).

member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IAssemblyReference).

member.summary: Returns a list of custom attributes that describes this type declaration member. Typically, these will be derived from this.SourceAttributes. However, some source attributes might instead be persisted as metadata bits and other custom attributes may be synthesized from information not provided in the form of source custom attributes. The list is not trimmed to size, since an override of this method may call the base method and then add more attributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.Aliases
member.summary: A list of aliases for the root namespace of the referenced assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.AssemblyAttributes
member.summary: A list of objects representing persisted instances of types that extend System.Attribute. Provides an extensible way to associate metadata with this assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.AssemblyIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.ContainingAssembly
member.summary: The assembly that contains this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.Culture
member.summary: Identifies the culture associated with the assembly. Typically specified for sattelite assemblies with localized resources. Empty if not specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.ExportedTypes
member.summary: Public types defined in other modules making up this assembly and to which other assemblies may refer to via this assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.Files
member.summary: A list of the files that constitute the assembly. These are not the source language files that may have been used to compile the assembly, but the files that contain constituent modules of a multi-module assembly as well as any external resources. It corresonds to the File table of the .NET assembly file format.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.Flags
member.summary: A set of bits and bit ranges representing properties of the assembly. The value of can be set from source code via the AssemblyFlags assembly custom attribute. The interpretation of the property depends on the target platform.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.HashValue
member.summary: The encrypted SHA1 hash of the persisted form of the referenced assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.IsRetargetable
member.summary: True if the implementation of the referenced assembly used at runtime is not expected to match the version seen at compile time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.Kind
member.summary: The kind of metadata stored in the module. For example whether the module is an executable or a manifest resource file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.MemberModules
member.summary: A list of the modules that constitute the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.ModuleIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.ModuleName
member.summary: The name of the module containing the assembly manifest. This can be different from the name of the assembly itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.PublicKey
member.summary: The public part of the key used to encrypt the SHA1 hash over the persisted form of this assembly . Empty if not specified. This value is used by the loader to decrypt HashValue which it then compares with a freshly computed hash value to verify the integrity of the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.PublicKeyToken
member.summary: The hashed 8 bytes of the public key called public key token of the referenced assembly. This is non empty of the referenced assembly is strongly signed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.Resources
member.summary: A list of named byte sequences persisted with the assembly and used during execution, typically via .NET Framework helper classes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.Assembly.SecurityAttributes
member.summary: A list of objects representing persisted instances of pairs of security actions and sets of security permissions. These apply by default to every method reachable from the module.

member.summary: Identifies the culture associated with the assembly reference. Typically specified for sattelite assemblies with localized resources. Empty if not specified.

member.summary: The encrypted SHA1 hash of the persisted form of the referenced assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ResolvedAssemblyReference.IsRetargetable
member.summary: True if the implementation of the referenced assembly used at runtime is not expected to match the version seen at compile time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ResolvedAssemblyReference.PublicKey
member.summary: The public part of the key used to encrypt the SHA1 hash over the persisted form of the referenced assembly. Empty if not specified. This value is used by the loader to decrypt an encrypted hash value stored in the assembly, which it then compares with a freshly computed hash value in order to verify the integrity of the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Ast.ResolvedAssemblyReference.PublicKeyToken
member.summary: The hashed 8 bytes of the public key called public key token of the referenced assembly. This is non empty of the referenced assembly is strongly signed.

member.summary: The referenced assembly.
